overview:
Mike Soenen is Founder/President & CEO of ClearTrial (acquired by Oracle in 2012), a provider of cloud-based software that helps life sciences companies reduce R&D costs, timelines, and inefficiencies in outsourcing operations. While at ClearTrial, Mike was named to the PharmaVOICE 100 Most Inspiring People in Pharma, and earned numerous innovation awards for the ClearTrial products, including Gartner Group’s Cool Companies in Life Sciences (2011) and the GCPj’s Best Technological Development in Clinical Trials (2008). Prior to ClearTrial, Mike co-founded and served as President & CEO of Consolidated Commerce, a provider of cloud-based supply chain software for fragmented industries, which was named in 1999 as one of the top 100 innovative companies on the InformationWeek 100. In 1994, Mike co-founded Waterstone Consulting (acquired by Ciber in 1999), a strategy and software consulting firm with expertise in supply chain, ERP, and complex pricing & contract management. Before Waterstone, Mike worked at Kraft Foods in their distribution and logistics systems area at and at Andersen Consulting (Accenture) in the firm’s Advanced Technology Group.

Mike received a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering / Computer Engineering sequence, from the University of Notre Dame.

video_embeds.description: Best Practices to Improve Operational Efficiency in Clinical Development
